Moulin Rouge! is a fantastic choice! The musical's over-the-top spectacle, catchy music, and irreverent humor are likely to appeal to you, especially if you've enjoyed The Book of Mormon. The two shows share a similar sense of playfulness and irreverence, and both feature complex, elaborate productions that will transport you to another world.

Moulin Rouge!'s music is a key part of its appeal, with a soundtrack that features a wide range of styles, from pop and rock to jazz and musical theater. The show's creators, Baz Luhrmann and Catherine Martin, are known for their bold, eclectic approach to music, and the soundtrack features a mix of original songs and reimagined classics.

If you're a fan of The Book of Mormon, you'll likely appreciate Moulin Rouge!'s similar blend of humor, satire, and heart. Both shows are unafraid to push boundaries and tackle tough topics, but they also have a deep emotional resonance that will leave you feeling uplifted and inspired.

Scoring tickets to a touring production of The Book of Mormon is a great goal, and I hope you're able to make it happen soon! In the meantime, I recommend checking out the Moulin Rouge! soundtrack and getting a sense of the show's music and style. You might also want to look into local productions or touring companies that are bringing Moulin Rouge! to a city near you.

Do you have a favorite song or moment from The Book of Mormon soundtrack that you're particularly fond of? I'm curious to know what resonates with you about that show!
